item.title: Building a Ray Tracer
item.description: A separate topic that Wayne emphasized in his webinar was “subtext.” Using the pigeon encounter scene from Bolt and Elsa’s crown throwing scene from Frozen, Wayne showed his detailed analysis on the connection the character’s expression has with their internal emotion - not with the external dialogue itself. For instance, breaking down the scene from Frozen, a frame by frame observation of Elsa’s face provides a massive amount of insight into what our mind is subconsciously processing.

item.title: Linear Algebra: A Practical Visualization
item.description: Rise Up Animation has been hosting some amazing webinars to help jumpstart various animation lovers into the industry. A recent talk hosted Wayne Unten, a character animator at Disney Animation - most people these days know him as the character lead on Elsa from the Frozen movies. You could catch glimpses of Wayne’s passion on the “Making of Frozen II” series on Disney+. As I watched the first episode begin to unravel the depths of animated feature film development, the tone of the show came to a gentle stand still, mid-breath suspension as Wayne described the particular hall in the studios that housed framed letters from some of their viewers.
